< Overview: All Nintendo Switch games for kids

With Minecraft, children can fully unleash their creativity

The game Minecraft, which is now more than 10 years old but is currently being developed more and more, is one of the most popular games of all time! Where else can children build anything they can imagine? Minecraft is so popular because you can build everything here and “craft” from collected ingredients:

  • houses, castles, a football stadium,
  • His own home or a tree house above the clouds
  • His own school
  • His favorite places from films and series
  • forests, parks, villages,
  • Volcanoes, mountains, bridges, tunnels
  • Prisons, traps, secret passages, dungeons, caves
  • Food, tools, weapons, armor and potions
  • Animals, Monsters, Humans
  • and more
  • and more
  • and more…

What is Minecraft? (simply explained for parents)
Parents often don’t understand at first why the game should be so great with the simple, outdated block graphics. Because there isn’t even a story to follow here.

Just imagine Minecraft as a “giant Lego box in 3D with monsters and more”, then you get an impression of what Minecrafters and little builders experience there.

Minecraft is super recommended for kids. There are even schools that use Minecraft to teach with! I don’t think I have to say more than: Just try it out. Because Minecraft is not expensive even on the switch. And let your kids creatively and imaginatively use the digital time that parents usually limit.

How to learn Minecraft

That’s right, while you can play Minecraft just like that, the game is so sophisticated and complex that you can always learn more. This is exactly what makes Minecraft so appealing. Here are a few tips on how to introduce and support young players to Minecraft.

Minecraft has 2 game modes that you can set in the menu and switch at any time. You don’t live long in survival mode, because the monsters come in the evening and you have to have built a house by then and at the same time satisfied your hunger with food. But don’t give up…

Just switch to creative mode and your child can build freely with all available bricks and you will not be attacked. You can build for hours like this.

More experienced kids then switch to survival mode at some point, because here you have to work out everything yourself. Cut down wood to get bricks to build with. Crafting clothes and weapons, hunting animals for food, building a fire to roast food, building intricate houses and much more.

Minecraft is complex, did we mention that? There are entire Wikipedias full of information on Minecraft on thousands of websites. Just google and you will be overwhelmed with information, sometimes you only understand the train station, because Minecraft is complex 🙂

Tip: Google for:

  • minecraft beginner tips
  • minecraft how to make meat
  • minecraft control switch
  • minecraft how to survive in survival mode
  • minecraft how to build weapons
  • minecraft how to build armor
  • minecraft how to get redstone
  • …

Have fun with your studying! Worth it! – and you show your kids how to solve problems with patience and Google’s help, you are the shining example here!

Anyone who plays Minecraft usually loves the programs of the well-known YouTube bloggers (on Youtube / Youtube Kids), who spread many Minecraft tricks and lots of funny stuff in a really good mood (and shrill voice and healthy chaos) in an exciting and entertaining way.

The target group tends to be young people, but kids from around 9 years of age are also very impressed. The good bloggers are really nice and pay attention to their language so as not to scare off the kids and their parents: “Very nice!” 🙂

Minecraft is a rather peaceful game, although you can fight here if you want (in survival mode). You can play it independently from about 8 years of age. However, parental support is helpful in expanding his possibilities in the game.

To two on a switch you need one to play second controller, because you need all the buttons of the switch controller and therefore cannot share it like in other switch games. Original Switch controllers don’t come cheap, but they’re a lot of fun.

To with to play multiple players, you can start in Minecraft in multiplayer mode. So you can then play online with numerous players at the same time. If you want to play with friends on site in the WLAN, you can start the local multiplayer mode. For this, each child needs their own switch.

Anyone who is fit in computers/IT can even do one own Minecraft server set up where children can meet up with their friends. The advantage is that you can play undisturbed with friends according to your own rules: set up a Minecraft server for children

Minecraft focuses on game mechanics and “just looks like Minecraft”, it has to be. But: You can extend Minecraft with “Mods”, “Themes” and “Skins” so that it looks better.

At some point you want to expand Minecraft so that it looks different and can do more. Yes, that is also possible, and it is really comprehensive. Actually, you should be able to learn Minecraft at school or study at university… The difficult thing about googling for Minecraft extensions is that Minecraft is available on different systems, such as PC, Mac, mobile/tablet, Playstation, Xbox and Switch.

Important: The console versions cannot do everything that the PC/Mac version can. For example, it is not so easy to download and install the so-called “mods” because many mods do not run on the console versions of Minecraft.

Tip: You can download a few mods, extensions, and skins from the Minecraft store. Try it out: Skyblock
